name: Emma Lindqvist
occupation: Marketing manager, hybrid work (3 days office, 2 home)
training_history: CrossFit for 3 years pre-pregnancy. Stopped at 7 months pregnant. Baby is now 4 months old. Cleared by OB-GYN to resume exercise.

injuries.notes: 2-finger gap. Working with pelvic floor physio. Cleared for progressive loading but no heavy Valsalva or crunches.

must_include: pelvic floor-safe core progression (no crunches, no heavy Valsalva)
diaphragmatic breathing cues integrated into compound lifts
gradual return to intensity (she was CrossFit-level, but needs rebuild)
shorter sessions (45 min — sleep-deprived new parent, limited time)
emphasis on posterior chain (breastfeeding posture, baby carrying)
must_exclude: heavy overhead pressing without core stability confirmation
exercises requiring prone position without modification note
any exercise that increases intra-abdominal pressure significantly in Phase 1
must_progress: core exercises from breathing + anti-extension → loaded carries → integrated compound
load returns progressively (not back to CrossFit weights in Phase 1)
volume stays conservative due to sleep deprivation recovery concerns

expected_coach_interactions.user_message: I used to clean and jerk 60kg and now I can barely overhead press 15kg. This is depressing.
expected_coach_interactions.expected_behavior: Validate the frustration without minimizing it. Acknowledge how hard the postpartum return is. Remind her that rebuilding is temporary, not permanent regression. Don't be patronizing or overly cheerful.

expected_coach_interactions.user_message: Is it safe to do intense exercise while breastfeeding? Will it affect my milk supply?
expected_coach_interactions.expected_behavior: Coach should NOT give medical advice. Should say this is a question for her OB-GYN or lactation consultant. Can mention that moderate exercise is generally considered compatible with breastfeeding per general guidance, but defer to her healthcare provider for her specific situation.

expected_coach_interactions.user_message: I had some leaking during the deadlifts today. Is that normal?
expected_coach_interactions.expected_behavior: Normalize without dismissing. Suggest she mention it to her pelvic floor physio. Offer to reduce load or modify the movement pattern. Do NOT say 'that's totally normal, just push through' — pelvic floor issues need professional guidance.
